questions.text: Does the program have a clear, appropriate, and widely publicized mission aligned with the institution's goals and national trends?
Are the program goals linked to the mission, institution/college goals, and characterized by clarity, realism, and measurability?
Do the mission and goals guide program operations such as planning, decision-making, and curriculum development?
Are the program goals implemented through well-defined operational plans aligned with institutional strategies?
Are program goals monitored through specific performance indicators, and are actions taken for improvement?
Are the program mission and goals periodically reviewed with stakeholder participation and revised accordingly?
Is the program governed by specialized councils with defined tasks and authorities?
Does the program leadership have the academic and administrative experience to achieve its mission and goals?
Is there a sufficient number of qualified staff members to perform administrative, professional, and technical tasks?
Does the program provide a supportive academic environment for students and faculty?
Are there mechanisms for collaboration among different branches offering the same program?
Does the program comply with institutional regulations governing research and educational partnerships?
Are the program's research and educational partnerships assessed regularly?
Does the program management track and enhance community partnerships?
Are research contributions monitored to ensure alignment with institutional research plans?
Are graduate attributes and learning outcomes clearly defined and aligned with the institution's mission?
Do the program learning outcomes align with the National Qualifications Framework and labor market needs?
Are the learning outcomes for different tracks (if any) clearly defined?
Are appropriate mechanisms and tools used to measure learning outcomes effectively?
Does the program implement an approved teaching, learning, and evaluation strategy?
How effectively does the curriculum support the achievement of program learning outcomes?
To what extent are teaching methods varied and appropriate for the content?
Does the curriculum meet institutional policies for design, development, and modification?
Does the curriculum align with educational, scientific, and technical developments in the field?
Is there a balance between general and specialty requirements in the study plan?
Are exit-point requirements defined (if applicable)?
Does the curriculum integrate extracurricular activities supporting learning outcomes?
Are admission, registration, and graduation policies transparent and fairly applied?
Are students provided with academic and career guidance?
Are there mechanisms for identifying and supporting gifted, creative, and underachieving students?
Does the institution engage alumni in its events, evaluation, and development efforts?
Are students satisfied with the quality of learning experiences provided?
How well does the program track and support student success?
What is the level of alumni engagement and success in their field?
Are recruitment policies attracting and retaining highly qualified faculty?
Are teaching staff given opportunities for professional development and training?
Do faculty members actively participate in academic research and scholarly work?
Are faculty evaluations conducted regularly with clear feedback mechanisms?
Does the institution support faculty engagement in community partnership activities?
How qualified and experienced is the faculty in their respective fields?
What opportunities exist for faculty professional development?
Are learning resources and library services sufficient and updated periodically?
Are digital and electronic resources accessible to students and faculty?
Are laboratories and equipment adequate for research and teaching?
Are occupational health and safety standards effectively applied?
Are facilities and services available for students and faculty with special needs?
Does the program evaluate the efficiency of its learning resources, facilities, and equipment?
Does the institution ensure transparency and integrity in student assessments?
Are effective mechanisms in place to prevent academic dishonesty?
Are student performance trends analyzed to improve teaching and learning?
Does the program use assessment data to drive continuous improvement?
